author: Staff Reporter
text:
Importance of voting being explained through videos screened on mega digital screen at Paliyankudisai, a tribal village in Theni district, on Friday, as part of the voter awareness campaign.

Election officials have intensified voter awareness campaign in remote villages on hills in the district, according to Collector N. Venkatachalam.

Distributing awareness pamphlets at Paliyankudisai village near Goodalur on Friday, he said the college and school students, SHG members,

NGOs were roped in to campaign on importance of casting votes and democratic right of voters, he added.

Officials should ensure that all the 40 families comprising 120 members were enrolled in the voter list. All arrangements have been made at villages in the hilly regions to enable the tribal people to cast their votes.

Model polling station

Model polling station was also set up in Goodalur municipality in Andipatti constituency. All women polling station would be established in all the four Assembly constituencies in the district, he added.

Earlier, he inspected an election control room established at Uthamapalayam and functioning of electronic video van under control of Department of Public Relations.
title: Election officials intensify voter awareness campaign
